column5: Season's greetings everyone!  I've never made the trek up to Southampton so I'm looking for some pointers.  With all this warm rain, I figure the steelhead will be making their way into the mouth of the river.  I'll be drifting roe bags, any tips on where and when?  Thanks so much!
friends of mine have been there for over a week now, and likely will be to close, havnt heard from them though
http://wateroffice.ec.gc.ca/report/report_e.html?type=realTime&stn=02FC001&prm1=46&prm2=-1  Rising level due to weather suggests it's blown
Might check out the Maitland on my way up.  Thoughts?

http://wateroffice.ec.gc.ca/report/report_e.html?type=realTime&stn=02FC001&prm1=46&prm2=-1  Rising level due to weather suggests it's blown yea we did get a chitload of rain.  I'm thinking early/mid next week so maybe that will be enough time for it to drop and clear a bit.......
A double/double from Tim Hortons will have better vis then the 'Geen right now.
A double/double from Tim Hortons will have better vis then the 'Geen right now.  Make it a 4x4 on the Notty.
Yeah man, everything is ripping!  Even the small trickles have some flow today    Coldwater is almost to the banks.
You are talkin dark roast!  That stuff is nasty.
haven't been to Tim's in 30+ years, it must be dark! Even the commercials make it look nasty
haven't been to Tim's in 30+ years, it must be dark! Even the commercials make it look nasty  LOL  I take a expresso anytime.

YES my man when we had the huts off the Oro ninth in the 80s the first thing was to put on the 12 cup espressos on the stove. Then a luch of veal or Italin sausages on buns. Nothing better than having a frying pan going all day long. How I miss those days.  Sorry for the Geen trek, may have thrown him off track! Listen to BillM.

How did we get from steelheading to coffee...LOL.  Not a tims coffee fan but I do like me a warm apple fritter.  Guess the season is blown but Mrs. K will be happy.  Its warm enough for me to clean out the garage..
